title: "required because of the requirements" compiler note provided when calling PartialEq::eq, but not when using the comparison operator

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
This version produces a not-very-useful error message:

```rust
#[derive(PartialEq)]
struct Wrapper<T>(T);

fn is_eq<T>(a: Wrapper<T>, b: Wrapper<T>) -> bool {
    a == b
}

fn main() {}
```

```
error[E0369]: binary operation `==` cannot be applied to type `Wrapper<T>`
 --> src/main.rs:5:5
  |
5 |     a == b
  |     ^^^^^^
  |
  = note: an implementation of `std::cmp::PartialEq` might be missing for `Wrapper<T>`
```

However, if you remove the operator syntax and call the trait directly, the error message is much improved:

```rust
fn is_eq<T>(a: Wrapper<T>, b: Wrapper<T>) -> bool {
    PartialEq::eq(&a, &b)
}
```

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `T: std::cmp::PartialEq` is not satisfied
 --> src/main.rs:5:5
  |
5 |     PartialEq::eq(&a, &b)
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ can't compare `T` with `T`
  |
  = help: the trait `std::cmp::PartialEq` is not implemented for `T`
  = help: consider adding a `where T: std::cmp::PartialEq` bound
  = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `std::cmp::PartialEq` for `Wrapper<T>`
  = note: required by `std::cmp::PartialEq::eq`
```
